text:
Nobody set their fastest times, not even Ferrari. That will happens only in Melbourne on Saturday afternoon.
This is not the old Ferrari, they got rid of the old baggage of conservatism that moved in after Todd and Brawn had left. 
Binotto is of another mold compared to Arrivabene and even Domenicali, he is probably the most experienced out there, a part for Newey, and he is likely as talented. Binotto changed quite a few things in the way they run the house. Also top management is younger than it has ever been and they are not afraid of matching Mercedes level of spending.
As Raikkonen liked to say: "Let's see what happens...."

text: TRUE!!! And since when did these so called "experts" ever got it right? I mean Ferrari have always been on top or near the top in testing! But as usual (or since 2014), Mercedes always bags the titles with races to spare! Most of us have been following the sport for a very long time yet some of us keep falling for the usual "traps" that testing results tell us. Lots of "experts" even come up with terms like "tire-corrected, "fuel-corrected"! Really??? Well, sure anyone can spot the tire used, that we can factor in easily. But, even with the C5 tire bolted on and the car does 2 or 3 laps sets a purple laptime and heads back to the pits, how do we know if the car had 3 laps worth of fuel? Was the engine mode aggressive? Was the battery discharge aggressive? Was the driver 100% pushing? Most know Mercedes sandbags alot! I do mean they probably are laughing at all these experts right now! We all know Mercedes never shows its true hand until Q3 of the first Grand Prix weekend. Also, the fact that Mercedes brought several new parts into Testing 2 just 4 days from the 1st Test means they have many iterations of the W10 readily available. They are simply just giving these parts a dry run!
author: Karl Owen Aurelio

text: Such bull from these guys! No one knows the individual setups, fuel loads etc yet they keep on referring to the times! Not important at this stage.
